data.title: Eclectic atmosphere
data.text: Good Tex-Mex, full bar that you can eat at without reservations (it was a Friday night). The decor is somewhat eclectic (cluttered) but it adds to a very youthful atmosphere.

data.title: Just ok
data.text:
If you love Tequila, this is the place for you with 100 different Tequilas. But the food was nothing special.  I had the Dos Tacos and had the Agi Tuna and the Tinga Taco. They were ok and the Tuna was good but otherwise not at all flavorful. More of a bar atmosphere. 

The margaritas were decent. I had the habenero lime Rita which had a kick.

data.title: Great Tacos and Cervezas
data.text: Stopped in here for lunch snack after shopping in Old Town Scottsdale.   Started out with some Margaritas on the rocks and ice cold Tecate. Their chips and salsa is spicy and wonderful.  Some of the best  I've had and the salsa had a hint of smoky flavor.  Good Stuff.   We had the street tacos including the chicken, beef and pork.  They were traditional street tacos and we thoroughly enjoyed them and ate every bit.  Atmosphere was spot on and the wait staff was excellent.  Stop in and you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Loud and disturbing atmosphere that the manager would do nothing about
data.text:
I visited this restaurant with a group of 19 and we were seated upstairs.  Seated nearby was another group who was loud and obnoxious throughout our visit.  The servers for our group were well aware of the very disruptive behavior that the other group was demonstrating but beyond apologizing, did nothing to rectify the situation.  The group was behaving in a manner appropriate for a loud and rowdy bar, rather than a family friendly restaurant, with continually yelling and screaming while drinking shots.  

Myself and another person from our group decided to politely ask the group to please lower their volume since we were not able to even converse with the people sitting directly next to us without shouting, which should not be necessary for a restaurant of this nature.  This polite attempt to quiet the group backfired with them being even louder and now making derogatory remarks towards our group.  

After putting up with this terrible environment for well over an hour, I decided to ask a manager to come over to discuss the matter with her.  After explaining the situation to the manager, the manager agreed that the restaurant was "family friendly" but then told me that there was not anything she could do unless they were swearing and hopefully they would be leaving soon.  I was shocked that the manager of the restaurant was condoning such loud and disruptive behavior from one party and would not even address the concern with them at all.  During this visit, I observed several other small parties being seated between my group and the loud group and after a very short time, those parties asked to be moved to a different table, probably due to the noise, understandably.  Obviously a group of 4 could easily be relocated to a different table but since my group was 19, such a request was not feasible due to the business of the restaurant overall.

Based on this experience, our group will not return to this restaurant due to the lack of regard the manager had for correcting the situation.  It is not unreasonable for a manager to ask a group to behavior in a manner that would be appropriate for the style of restaurant, especially when they were obviously disrupting and detracting from the experience of many other customers.

data.title: Great Taco special
data.text: We were in Old Town looking for a light lunch.  Saw the board out front for $2 tacos and $2 Tecate.  Could not pass up this bargain.  We each ordered 2 shredded beef tacos in hard shell.  Fresh tasting shell filled with tasty shredded beef and topped with cheese, lettuce, tomato and....shredded purple cabbage.  A new and unique taste.  Their red salsa was very good...and the Tecate very cold.  Hubby had a very good house margarita.  Good lunch stop.

data.title: Above Average Mexican
data.text: Above average Mexican food and very reasonable prices (burrito for $12 for dinner).  They have a massive list of margarita options - if that is you're love this is probably a five star place for you!

data.title: Best margarita EVER!
data.text: We stopped in for a quick bite and a drink while exploring Old Town.  I had a prickly pear margarita and it was honestly the best margarita I have ever had!  The tacos were excellent as well.  We had the Tinga and the shredded beef.  Both of these were fantastic.  If you are in Old Town Scottsdale, try it!  Service was a little slow at the bar but she was really busy.

data.title: Great food & kid friendly
data.text: My family recently had lunch at Cien Agaves.  Great character & food, kid friendly and excellent service!

data.title: Great happy hour, great tacos, cheap cevice and margaritas
data.text: Perhaps if you come here outside of Happy Hour the prices are higher but as long as you come between 3-6pm it's pretty hard to beat Cien Agaves. I have cravings for this place, dream about it, and must hold myself back from the urge to go and scarf cevice, tacos and margaritas. No where else can you find good cevice for $5 and a good portion of it too. $2 tacos don't hurt and cheap margaritas take it to the level of god-like. The food is good, not amazing, but consistently good. The service has always been good as well and though they do get busy the wait staff is responsive and eager to get you more drinks. The taco selections are pretty unique and tasty. This is not your run of the mill mexican place, it's a bit more adventurous, a little dia de los muertos, and often is buzzing with activity. It's family friendly also but can often be loud but not overly so. A definite do not miss in Scottsdale for Happy Hour but take the free trolly, a golf cart taxi or Uber because in Scottsdale you don't need to hit .08 to get a DUI it's up to the officer to decide if you are intoxicated. You have been warned.

data.title: Excellent Happy Hour
data.text:
We enjoyed half-price margaritas and appetizers on the patio the other day.  The atmosphere on the patio is a little bland -- it's just two rows of tables in an alleyway between the buildings.  But it was nice to be outside where it was much quieter.  Our server was attentive and well-meaning, but everything seemed to take twice as long as it should.  This was probably due to the long distance from the kitchen/bar to the last of the outside table where we sat, and also they might have been a little understaffed.
All-in-all, the food, drink and value were great while the atmosphere and delivery timing were a little lacking.

data.title: Fun Mexican Restaurant
data.text: 9 of us went for dinner and had apps, great margerita's and entree's. Good prices, great portions, tasty and great happy hour too.

data.title: Excellet food.  Great Happy Hour.
data.text: My wife and I had a great meal there last week.  Their happy hour runs from 3:00pm to 7:00pm and includes half price house margaritas and half price appetizers.  We ordered the chicken nachos to share and they were wonderful.  Had we not ordered anything else we would have left satisfied, but we did order more.  My wife ordered tacos and I ordered enchiladas.  Both were extremely tasty and reasonably priced.  We both left more full than we intended, but very pleased with our choice of restaurant.  It is a fun, casual atmosphere, nicely done.  If we return to the Phoenix are, we would certainly return to this restaurant.

data.title: Great
data.text: Awesome food and atmosphere. Would go back again without question. The fish tacos were some of the best I've ever had.

data.title: Absolutely best shrimp tacos I have ever had.
data.text: Great place, good atmosphere, hip place. Not too loud. Food was absolutely delicious. Friendly staff.

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: Staying in scottsdale for two weeks( over from the UK).  Went to cien agaves twice,lovely place. Servers were very welcoming,made you feel at home straight away. Couldn't fault the food and drink especially the margaritas. Will be returning.

data.title: Tequila & tacos
data.text: I had a prickly pear margharita made with fresh prickly pear puree and ahi tuna tacos. I am still craving those tacos and will definitely be dining here when I am in Scottsdale again.

data.title: Best Happy Hour
data.text: We went to Scottsdale for a 3 day stay.  We spent every happy hour at Cien Agaves...best happy hour.  Very good margaritas and taco's, great service and great happy hour atmosphere.  If you're looking for a great place go to Cien Agaves.

data.title: Great Little Authentic Stop
data.text: We came here on recommendation from a store owner. Not to be disappointed. The food was great and the service. I would definitely reccom👍

data.title: Melting pot for people
data.text: I don't know if this is a place where the locals go or there aren't any locals in the area but when we dined there, there were a lot of out of towners in the building.  Made for a nice atmosphere.  The food was delicious and prepared well.  The server was attentive and talkative, has an opportunity to know you a little.  Plenty of room for larger parties.

data.title: Fun place and yummy food
data.text: We sat at the bar and really enjoyed our Happy Hour Margaritas, so we sat right there and had dinner. Plenty of good food and value pricing!
